title: HammerSky 2014 The Party Estate Grown Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Merlot and 25% Petit Verdot is all about richness, starting with aromas of vanilla, caramel, milk chocolate, licorice and black-currant crème brûlée. Soft and plush on the palate, the butterscotch, candied blueberry and black plum-syrup flavors are laid across slices of hot spice cake and lifted by mulling spices.

title: Hertelendy 2014 Signature Mountain Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a Merlot-driven blend at 82%, with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon, 4% Malbec and 2% Petit Verdot. The Merlot is from an older site on Howell Mountain. Spicy nutmeg seasons a soft, rounded palate of integrated tannin and full-bodied but balanced weight, the fruit flavor crisp in cherry, raspberry and cassis, just a touch of butterscotch revealed at the wine's end.

title: Istine 2015 Vigna Casanova dell'Aia  (Chianti Classico)
description: Quintessential Sangiovese aromas of pressed violet, wild berry, new leather and dark culinary spice pave the way on this delicious wine. Tight and structured, the elegant palate delivers juicy red cherry, licorice and truffle. Bright acidity and assertive, refined tannins provide energy and compelling tension. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Jäger 2016 Ried Achleiten Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
description: Freshly cut green and ripe yellow pear notes appear enticingly on the nose of this wine. The palate takes these along and adds zesty citrus brightness and a spicy herbal tang of sage and celery salt. It's taut, fresh, concentrated and muscular, without any fat.

title: Jalits 2015 Szapary Reserve Blaufränkisch (Eisenberg)
description: A touch of mahogany and bitter almond colors the tight, dark fruit on the nose, which translates as black cherry on the taut, immensely concentrated palate. Fine, drying tannin, warming alcohol and bright acidity highlight the fruit flavors, yet right now there still is a bitter edge of tannin that needs to mellow. The stuffing is there to go the distance—this is a big and muscular wine. Drink 2022–2032.

title: Loimer 2016 Ried Käferberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: This wine suggests fresh greenery on the nose: sage and fern are the foremost aromas. The palate brims with an intense savoriness recalling miso, salt and soy. It's intense, concentrated and compact and totally designed for the long run. Drink 2019–2030.

title: Neumeister 2015 Ried Moarfeitll Sauvignon Blanc (Vulkanland Steiermark)
description: This wine's tart, spiky glints of passion fruit tease the nose amidst all its lemony freshness. With a little air, the passion fruit note grows smoother and fuller. The palate glows in this fruitiness and complements it with creamy richness. It's lovely and seductive now but sure to get even better. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Pence 2015 Fugio Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Playing to the tangier side of the grape, this bottling offers dewy sagebrush, barely ripe red currant, white pepper and a hint of tapenade on the nose. The flavors are more rounded with tart cranberry and tangy red-plum skins, enhanced by thyme, dill, green peppercorn and exotic coriander spice. It is very well structured.

title: Steindorfer 2015 Reserve St. Laurent (Burgenland)
description: A beautifully evocative red cherry aroma perfumes the nose, joined by a gentle oak tone. The palate has a graceful, fine structure of subtle but firm tannins that frame the rich, ripe red cherry flavor. There still is bite and freshness, making the generous weight appear all the more alluring. A touch of cinnamon makes this feel even more sumptuous. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Black Kite 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine presents as weighty and broad on entry, a successful exploration of juicy black cherry, toasted oak and cardamom that is both succulent and complex. It develops nuance and balance in the glass, with an exotic floral quality that's hard to resist.

title: Geyerhof 2016 Ried Goldberg Riesling (Kremstal)
description: Earth, yeast and saltiness color the lemony freshness of this wine's aroma. They also give a funky twirl to the palate, which shines with tart but ripe red apple and orange flavors. Underneath is a bright vein of lemon zest. It pulls the focus into the long finish, which tingles long after you have swallowed. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Jalits 2015 Diabas Reserve Blaufränkisch (Eisenberg)
description: Lovely notes of black cherry on the nose have a pleasant edge of bitter almond. The palate is dense with that same aromatic cherry and has both ample power and concentration to make this a rather muscular, potent wine. The tannins are fine and have a soft but distinct grip, with a warming, long finish. Drink 2022–2032.

title: Jurtschitsch 2016 Ried Käferberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: Fragrant green notes inform the nose of this wine: there are moss and sage, citrus foliage and fern scents. That herbal richness also plays on the slender, fresh and streamlined palate. Citrus freshness emanates from the textured flavors, softened slightly by salty yeast notes. An impressive, concentrated wine with lots of potential. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Malat 2016 Ried Höhlgraben Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: This wine's clean, ripe yellow pear notes stream from the glass, accentuated even more by bright, lemony freshness. This fruity combo continues throughout the slender, lithe palate, which reveals intriguing celery salt and fennel seed notes as you slowly savor. It is made all the more precise by fresh, lemon-like acidity. Gorgeous now but sure to develop. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Markowitsch 2015 Ried Rosenberg Red (Carnuntum)
description: Violet, tar, walnut and plum unite into a heady trip of olfactory pleasure. A dense palate packed with black cherry and ripe blueberry has such freshness and concentration that both alcohol and oak are taken in complete stride. A dense parcel of elegance that remains resolutely refreshing despite ripeness, crunch and power.

title: Merry Edwards 2015 Flax Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Baking spice and baked plum highlight a juicy, velvety explosion of sultry fruit in this well-made, full-bodied wine. Toasted oak wraps around hints of pine forest and mushroom, with a layering of dried herb and a tart rhubarb-kissed finish.

title: Patz & Hall 2015 Bootlegger's Hill Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Salt rock, caramel and quince combine effortlessly in this medium-bodied wine with a wealth of elegance and structure. The soft texture provides a framework for its balanced complexity and length of baking spice.

title: Richard Rottiers 2016  Moulin-à-Vent
description: Made from organically grown grapes, this wine comes from vines that are between 40 and 80 years old. It has structure, tannins and concentration as well as richness, powerful blackberry flavors and a balance with acidity. The wine will age, so drink from 2019.

title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2016 Ried Gaisberg Riesling (Kamptal)
description: The nose of this wine is still subdued. Hints of wet earth and pure lemon notes can barely be discerned. With a few swirls of the glass, tender hints of blood orange zest pervade nose and palate, alongside spiky, bright lemon notes. The body is slender and taut but brims with gorgeous citrus aromas. Lovely now but sure to last. Drink 2018–2030.

title: Sirius 2013 Eaglepoint Ranch Petite Sirah (Mendocino)
description: A deep color and thick aromas of blackberry and black fig lead to opulent mouth-filling dark-fruit flavors and a velvety substantive texture. This wine ranks with Turley and Carlisle Petite Sirahs at the top of the quality pyramid in California. It has all the expected tannin along with oodles of fruity, smoky richness to stand up to it. Best through 2028.

title: Spottswoode 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa-Sonoma)
description: This stunning white is sourced from a handful of sources, including the producer's estate, but also Hyde Vineyard in Carneros, Stagecoach on Atlas Peak, and several sites on Sonoma Mountain. It offers a demure nose of honeysuckle and peach before allowing room for lemon, quince and dried herb to come forth on the creamy palate, finishing bright and fresh in acidity.

title: Wohlmuth 2015 Ried Gola Alte Reben Pinot Gris (Südsteiermark)
description: Wet pebbles, nutty roundness, pear peel and a touch of smoke: the aromas in this wine will make you see Pinot Gris with fresh eyes. The palate has a translucent, filigreed slenderness, yet it packs a whole world of flavor. The midpalate reveals a sonorous backdrop of smokiness, against which fresh lemon notes soar. Dry, structured, eleganct and ageworthy. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Buchegger 2016 Ried Vordernberg Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)
description: A touch of leesy freshness clings to the lemon notes on the nose of this wine, revealing how very young it still is. The palate has a textured mouthfeel that owes as much to yeast as it does to lemon zestiness. With its great concentration, it still needs time to unfurl the full force of its citrus power. The finish is incisive, long and lemony. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Adelaida 2015 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: This is a delicious, dark and suave blend of 32% Syrah, 22% Petite Sirah, 20% Mourvèdre, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6% Viognier. Roasty aromas of cocoa and coffee mesh with elegant and rich black plum on the nose. The palate is wrapped in polished tannins, full of both power and finesse, with black currant, espresso, loamy earth, pepper and chaparral herb flavors.

title: Ancien 2015 Musque Chardonnay (Coombsville)
description: From the Haynes Vineyard, this is a beautifully floral wine on the nose, dripping in honeysuckle. Green apple and Bosc pear are deeply interwoven into the softly structured fabric of its balanced ripeness, as ginger and nutmeg highlights provide depth. The acidity is lasting and well mannered through the finish.

title: Birichino 2014 Lilo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There's a fascinating and lovable rustic quality to this single-vineyard bottling, which is slightly cloudy in the glass and shows aromas of red cherry, hickory smoke, dust and a feral gaminess. That foxy element is prevalent on the sip, with hints of animal hide and dried chaparral set against pomegranate and wild strawberry flavors.

title: Gary Farrell 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From a prime vineyard along Westside Road, this is a restrained take on a warm site and concentrated vintage, with beautiful floral aromas at its heart. Gravenstein apple and stone fruit play well against each other, alternating in tartness and succulent fleshy flavor. The acidity is buoyant and focused, offering a bit of precision to the palate.

title: Hall 2014 Jack's Masterpiece Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a sturdy, grippy and youthful 100% varietal wine, from vineyards planted in mountainous locations. Bright focused acidity lifts dense flavors of black cherry and sage that are wrapped in spicy, clove-driven oak. Enjoy best from 2024–2034.

title: Hall 2014 The North End Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is an inaugural release, blended with 7% Merlot and aged 22 months in French oak, 65% new. From vines grown predominantly in the northern end of the valley (Calistoga and St. Helena), it features a grainy texture of bold dark cherry that's granular and focused on the palate. Tobacco and leather add to the savory nature of the billowy tannin power. Enjoy best 2020–2030.

title: Johanneshof Reinisch 2015 Holzspur St. Laurent (Thermenregion)
description: There is a savory, gamy touch to the red cherry aroma on the nose. The palate counters this with crunchy, vivid cherry flavors, with a fine tannic grip offering a wild but alluring quality. A very individual but beautiful expression of this grape. Drink 2019–2030.
